member.name: T:AzureServiceBusUtils.AzureServiceBusBroadcaster
member.summary: Multiple nodes can all connect to a Service Bus topic, each one will create its own subscription and then they can all communicate with other nodes using Broadcast messages (pub-sub). Examples: When new nodes start in a blue-green deployment they can notify all other nodes and old nodes can check if they should still be up or if they should get inactive

member.name: T:AzureServiceBusUtils.AzureServiceBusScheduler
member.summary: Using Service Bus Queues (with Message Duplication detection enabled) we can use the Queue as a simple scheduler. In a multinode cluster all nodes can define the same scheduled jobs, they will all enqueue the execution of jobs as a scheduled message which will only be delivered when it's time for the job to run, and only one node will get the message and trigger the job.
